channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scientists confirm what employees already know: Working from home really does make you happier
item.description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella may think that remote work weakens social ties and makes workers less innovative, but the research is in and one thing is ...

item.title: Federal Reserve to Meet Under Cloud of Trump’s Attacks
item.description: Stephen Miran and Lisa Cook will both cast votes at the central bank’s meeting on Wednesday, where policymakers are expected to lower interest rates.

item.title: Trump is pushing for a ‘big cut’ from the Fed—but he’s already on a losing streak
item.description: Trump failed to oust Fed Governor Lisa Cook and is unlikely to get the steep rate cut he demands, as Powell and the FOMC weigh weaker jobs data.

item.title: F.B.I. Agents Fired by Patel Speak Out on ‘Broken’ Trust
item.description: The two agents’ accounts offer an inside view of a bureau buffeted by politics and upheaval, adding to the scrutiny of the F.B.I. director as he prepa...

item.title: 20 Years Ago, Alinea Electrified Chicago Dining. Does It Still Matter?
item.description: At this famously innovative restaurant, our critic finds a mix of thought-provoking experiments and empty spectacle.

item.title: ‘Peak Goldilocks’: The markets have bought the Fed rumors — watch for them to sell on the news
item.description: Markets will move on Wednesday after Wall Street parses Cook’s statement and his Q&A for clues about future rate cuts beyond Wednesday.

item.title: U.N. Inquiry Says Israel Is Committing Genocide, and Trump Threatens Crackdown on Liberal Groups
Kennedy Says He Won’t Take Away Vaccines. Don’t Believe Him.
item.description: A meeting of a C.D.C. advisory committee could restrict vaccine access.

item.title: What CEOs think about the SEC ‘prioritizing’ Trump’s plan to end quarterly reporting for public companies
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The first person to get a Neuralink chip in his brain says he met Elon Musk on the day of his surgery: ‘He’s a cool dude’
item.description: The 31-year-old Neuralink brain-computer interface recipient says he and Musk later discussed SpaceX and had an "alien talk."

item.title: Israel Is Committing Genocide in Gaza, U.N. Inquiry Says
item.description: In earlier reports, the commission found that Israel had committed war crimes and crimes against humanity in its conflict with Hamas, but stopped shor...

item.title: New Research Helps Explain Gas Craters in Siberia
item.description: Spontaneous gas explosions appear to be increasing in northern Russia because of climate change and some specific local conditions.

item.title: Trump Gets a Second State Visit to the U.K.
item.description: President Trump will be in the U.K. this week in an unprecedented second state visit. Mark Landler, the London bureau chief of The New York Times, des...

item.title: Trump Leaves Tense America Behind for Royal Retreat on U.K. State Visit
item.description: President Trump’s trip to Britain will involve horse-drawn carriages and a stay in an ancient castle. For British officials, the visit may feel less l...
